question: Which country houses the National Marine Park of Zakynthos?
explanation: The National Marine Park of Zakynthos is an IUCN category II national park founded in 1999, located in Laganas bay, in Zakynthos island, Greece. The park, part of the Natura 2000 ecological network, and is the habitat of the loggerhead sea turtle (Caretta caretta). It is the first national park established for the protection of sea turtles in the Mediterranean.
